page.title: 19Local History In Norton Area
page.content: Stockton Norton School, which opened in 1858,was built by Thomas Whitmore of Apley Park. There was a school in Norton before that _ at least as early as 1800. There were also schools at Sutton Maddock and Ryton, but both closed some years ago. The clock on our school was given by Isabella Foster of Apley Park, in 1897, to mark Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee. A fountain on the roadside at Sutton Maddock marks the same year. The builder's workshop , between Harrington and Beckbury, used to be a water pumping station for the Borough of Wenlock. The building just before the bridge over the River Worfe near Beckbury was also an old pumping station. These are no longer used , as the area is now served by the Severn Trent Water Authority.
